string.value: Nothing is sacred to these wandering bandits. Anyone can fall victim to their attacks, be it a lone traveler or an armed caravan.
Traveling the world in search of adventures, as if life is not dangerous enough, they may easily become foes or allies, depending on the situation.
Nowadays their numbers grew thin. But if you happen to meet an Explorer, you can count on a pleasant conversation and help in any trouble.
Independent traders who have not joined any major faction are eager to trade with anyone who they meet.
Most dangerous warriors of the new world form this esteemed guild. They fight for money, but abide by strict code of honor.
In turbulent times, heralds of disaster appear everywhere, often themselves contributing to its imminent arrival.
The farmers cultivate the land as their ancestors. Having nothing but their vegetables, they rarely get attacked by raiders.

The common people dislike this group, because the Technicians, who collect knowledge of the ancient world, share it only for a high price. Furthermore, they mostly operate with the hands of mercenaries, preferring to stay behind the security of their walls.

Honest traders who built their initial capital by trading oil. They then managed to establish a foothold in the inhospitable northern region of Hel and built an entire city there, leading the faction to even greater fortunes. Unscrupulous competitors often engage in sabotage against them.

Detractors call them Secret Alliance for some past misdeeds and for their ties to various gangs and mercenaries. It is not without reason that the Alliance is believed to have been buying up stolen goods and not being shy about dealing in contraband.

One of the many local gangs, willing to take control over the Vaterland. The situation is complicated by the fact that they managed to get into an ancient military base and get hold of the real power to accomplish what they set out to do.

Small-time criminals who have settled on the fruitful lands of the Krai and collect rent from farmers in exchange for "protection" from other gangs. This situation has been going on for several years now, and seems to be acceptable to everyone.

It is unknown what they manage to catch in the freezing dead waters, but these folk live a prosperous life. Sometimes they trade with outsiders, but more often they just attack foreigners without warning.

Inspired by the charismatic leader Axel, the inhabitants of Argen have risen in unison to fight their neighbors, who once wronged them, and are quite successful in expanding their zone of influence, taking under their control all the new villages. They are not shy of using the services of mercenaries and cutthroats of all stripes.

The sudden attack of once friendly neighbors united the people of Librium, and following the testaments of their ancestors, they decided to fight for their independence. In waging war, they resort more often to espionage and sabotage than to brute force.

This mysterious organization has adepts all over the world. Although the active support of CD has somewhat tarnished their reputation as seekers of truth and order, the Church's influence is considerable.
The defenders of the local crime Boss.

These children of nature live in peace with the universe, growing unseen trees and performing rituals at their roots, they celebrate life in all its manifestations. They do not fancy foreigners, considering them to be depraved people.

The ex-Druids, disillusioned with their faith, have begun worshipping metal idols, which keep appearing in the Sacred Grove. They are friendly to the newcomers from across the sea and willingly trade with them. The Children of Iron themselves are hoping to someday have stainless steel bodies as strong as the idols they worship.
A small sect that lives near the Oracle's tower and honors him as a god.

Mysterious creations of hellfire, capable of shattering huge rocks and toppling giant trees. An encounter with any of their tribe brings swift death. Only the Children of Iron were able to find common language with them.
The natives of Oasia, who are trying to rebuild what the long war destroyed. But for some reason, they can't seem to finish what they started...
A people tormented by the constant attacks of an unknown enemy. But for some reason they can never win...
Also known as the Keepers of the Memory, the old people left towns and are hiding from everybody.
People of Argen not content with Axel’s rule.
The leader of the Crimson Dawn.
Pretty girl that travels the world pursuing some goal of her own.
Defenders of the secret town of Zeon.
Sinx. A strange fellow, who has no permanent residence.
The people of Seil remain neutral and supply power to both warring sides. No one but them can maintain the power plant, so they have not been attacked so far.
They control most of the oil production of the region.
People, living deep in the desert and studying its mysteries.
A group of madmen haunts the desert. They only seek death to others or to themselves.
Tired from the crimes, these bandits found peace in the middle of the jungle.
Even among the Uluk’s people there still are loyal druids.
The gang that wages war with the traders. Probably, they are allied with the Fishermen.
No one knows what these people manage to fish from the lifeless waters of the ocean. But the fishers seem quite happy with their lives.
A group of archaeologists exploring the ancient ruins between Porto and Roadster.
